trans-unit.source: "Netflix is pleased to announce the open-source release of our crisis management orchestration framework: Dispatch! [built with FastAPI]"
"Honestly, what you've built looks super solid and polished. In many ways, it's what I wanted Hug to be - it's really inspiring to see someone build that."
"I’m over the moon excited about FastAPI. It’s so fun!"
"If you're looking to learn one modern framework for building REST APIs, check out FastAPI [...] It's fast, easy to use and easy to learn [...]"
"We adopted the FastAPI library to spawn a REST server that can be queried to obtain predictions. [for Ludwig]"
"We've switched over to FastAPI for our APIs [...] I think you'll like it [...]"

"[...] I'm using FastAPI a ton these days. [...] I'm actually planning to use it for all of my team's ML services at Microsoft. Some of them are getting integrated into the core Windows product and some Office products."
"parsing"

requests - Required if you want to use the TestClient.
jinja2 - Required if you want to use the default template configuration.
uvicorn - for the server that loads and serves your application.
python-multipart - Required if you want to support form
email_validator - for email validation.
aiofiles - Required if you want to use FileResponse or StaticFiles.
ujson - Required if you want to use UJSONResponse.
ujson - for faster JSON
orjson - Required if you want to use ORJSONResponse.
graphene - Required for GraphQLApp support.
Pydantic for the data parts.
itsdangerous - Required for SessionMiddleware support.
pyyaml - Required for Starlette's SchemaGenerator support (you probably don't need it with FastAPI).
Starlette for the web parts.
--reload: make the server restart after code changes. Only do this for development.
UUID objects.
app: the object created inside of main.py with the line app = FastAPI().
datetime objects.
main: the file main.py (the Python "module").
FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production
CORS
Cookie Sessions
Documentation: https://fastapi.tiangolo.com
Easy: Designed to be easy to use and learn. Less time reading docs.
Fast to code: Increase the speed to develop features by about 200% to 300%. *
Fast: Very high performance, on par with NodeJS and Go (thanks to Starlette and Pydantic). One of the fastest Python frameworks available.
Fewer bugs: Reduce about 40% of human (developer) induced errors. *
GraphQL
Intuitive: Great editor support.
Note:
Robust: Get production-ready code. With automatic interactive documentation.
Short: Minimize code duplication. Multiple features from each parameter declaration. Fewer bugs.
Source Code: https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi
Spoiler alert: the tutorial - user guide includes:
Standards-based: Based on (and fully compatible with) the open standards for APIs: OpenAPI (previously known as Swagger) and JSON Schema.

FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production
FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.6+ based on standard Python type hints.
FastAPI stands on the shoulders of giants:
Files.

Independent TechEmpower benchmarks show FastAPI applications running under Uvicorn as one of the fastest Python frameworks available, only below Starlette and Uvicorn themselves (used internally by FastAPI). (*)
